Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that is healthy and growing with water and light, showing strong colors, upright stems, and multiple leaves.
The student can draw a plant that is wilted or not growing because it does not have water, depicting drooping leaves and pale colors.
The student can illustrate the difference between plants with water and without water, clearly showing two distinct plant conditions side by side.
The student can show that plants cannot live or grow without water, perhaps including details like a water droplet symbol, sun, and cross-out signs for wilted plants.
CANNOT: The student may sometimes omit minor elements like the label for sunlight (occasionally forgets minor details).
The student might not always perfectly scale the size of the healthy plant compared to the wilted one but effectively conveys the concept of growth.
